Posts.Content: Hi. I had a WLE and a sentinel lymph node biopsy in august. I was told they only take one node now . Unfortunately my node was positive so I was left with the agonising decision  to have a complete lymph node clearance or just radiotheraphy. I decided to have the clearance.that took place last thursday. Got the results yesterday and all nodes clear. Ifeel now that I put myself through the op for nothing but I wouldnt have been able to rest not knowing. So far no signs lymphodema Hope this helps
Posts.Title: SENTINEL NODE BIOPSY - PLEASE HELP

Posts.Content: I finished 15 sessions of radiotherapy in 6th dec leaving me with a sore blistered boob which is im glad to say on the mend. The last few days ive been having quite a weird pain/sensation in my neck. I dont know if this is connected to rads or a symptom of lymph node clearance. Any one else had a similar experience.
Posts.Title: radiotherapy after effects

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. Im so glad to hear you made the right decision for you to finish work. I will see tomorrow when I have appointment with my oncologist . I think ive more ir less decided on chemo, although having seen what my husband is going through I feel terrified. What is this macmillan grant. I too feel bad if I have to take benefits, but im 61 and have worke alll my life since 16, so I think its about time. Take care good luck
Posts.Title: guilty not working

Posts.Content: Hi michelle thanks for your reply. My name is pauline by the way. Im afraid my employers are not as considerate as yours, im not going to leave though as long as I get the sick notes I will stay off. I dont think I will be emotionally ready when I start chemo, especially with the hair loss. You mentioned in one post that you take bisoprolol, I to take this for palpitations, has it interfered with your treattment at all. Ive requested you as a friend. Take care and good luck xxx big hugs
Posts.Title: guilty not working

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. Ive been off work now about 3 weeks after complete lymph node clearance. Iv seen oncologist who recomends chemo, although the nodes were clear apart from SNB which was taken in august when I had lumpectomy.I took about 10 days off after first op. Ive now got to decided if I want chemo which will be 6 EC sessons every 3 weeks with possible radiotherapy in between or after. It looks like a long haul in front of me and im an emotional wreck at mo as my husband is undergoing chemo for liver cancer. I only work 15 hours a week in a small office and the other 2 employees are I presume doing my work. I dont want to mess them about by going back then having more time off for maybe bad days. They are paying me as normal at the mo although they are getting my sick notes. I had alot of holidays to take so maybe thats why they paying me as I wont get them in before year end. I need the money but feel guilty as they may need to get some one else in long term. Sorry to go on just fed up of everything today.
Posts.Title: guilty not working

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. I kind of think sometimes stuff work but im not really that kind of person. I really dont know how to handle it. Like you I dont want to break down in front of customers and the thought of going to work when I loose my hair fills me with terror. Any way ive rambled enough. Would love to talk privately. Not sure how we do that. Good luck on your journey through this horrible horrible disease.
Posts.Title: guilty not working

Posts.Content: Hi june thanks for your reply. Everyone who has replied to my post seems to have considerate employers. Im not so sure about mine. Anyway ive decided not to havechemo after a long discussion with oncologist this morning. She told me out of 100 women with similar circumstances to me only 3 would benefit from chemo. Im not prepared to put myself through it with those odds. Im having radiotherapyand letrozol.. take care and good luck.
Posts.Title: guilty not working

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply I suppose we are  all in same boat as regards working and money. Just hate being out of action just want things to be normal again. I suppose getting second opinion will delay things. Just want it over and done. Good luck on your journey.
Posts.Title: guilty not working

Posts.Content: Hi Michelle. Im about to start chemo and been told I will be taking anastrozole. I have been taking bisoprolol fumerate for over 3 years for an irregular heartbeat that causes palpitations. Im a bit concerned about the side effects of chemo on the heart. Are you on bisoprolol already or are they combing it with anastrozle.hope you going on ok and are slowly getting over the loss of ypur pet. I to have a faithful friend who is nearly 14 and very steady. My husband has metastatic liver cancer so life is not so good at the mo. Never mind chin up. Takecare
Posts.Title: FEELING REALLY DEPRESSED

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy last August, complete lymph node clearance in september then 15 sessions of radiotherapy.  Been on letrozole since January. I still get a lot of pain in my breast and armpit. And sometimes my other breast aches. I wonder if its the letrozole. Anyone else experienced this.
Posts.Title: breast pain

Posts.Content: Hi thanks for your reply. My onc told me its a relatively new drug. Im 61 so post menopausal and have already had all the nasties that go with it hot flushes etc so looks like its round 2 maybe for that. Deep joy. Never mind like you said if it keeps us alive I can cope. Didnt realise hair loss was a big sude effect listed as a least common one on my leaflet  with tabs. I didnt have chemo either and hoped id got away with hair loss. Ah well never mind. Good luck with your treatment and recovery.
Posts.Title: side effects of letrozol

Posts.Content: You should go to your manager and complain about this young mans ignorant comments and behaviour. Just mention the 2010 Equality Act which goes into great detail on this Macmillan site. They cant discriminate against you because of what you have, they have to support you and make your working conditions as easy as they can for you. Good luck.
Posts.Title: side effects of letrozol

Posts.Content: I hope your hair will be ok as well.  I Havnt had chemo but didnt realise this drug had that side effect. Good luck with your treatment and recovery
Posts.Title: side effects of letrozol

Posts.Content: Happy birthday. Hope you have a lovely day. Ive only been taking this for a week, but have already noticed how tired im getting and my knees and wrists ache all the time. Never mind as long as it works . Good luck and again happy birthday
Posts.Title: side effects of letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi little jude. Yes my oncologist told me this was a fairly new drug with better results than the others. So guess will have to stick it out and get on with the side effects. Like you say it could be a combined age thing. Take care and good luck.
Posts.Title: side effects of letrozol

Posts.Content: Ive just started taking letrozol and havnt seen it mentioned much usually tamoxifen is taken. Anybody had any side effects from letrozol
Posts.Title: side effects of letrozol

Posts.Content: After having a positive result for my sentinel lymph node biopsy, I was faced with the decision whether or not to have a lymph node clearance or just radiotheraphy. I decided on the op and to my relief the other nodes were clear. The effects of the op  are not pleasant. I dont have much feeling down the back of my arm. Under the arm feels like pins and needles, numb and swollen, although there is no swelling. I only had op just over a week ago. I feel as if ive put mysef through the op for nothing as results were good. Anybody else had the experience. Will the sensation in arm get better. Thanks
Posts.Title: complete lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. Just reasuring that post op sensations are quite normal. I to feel sometimes I have a massive swelling but there is nothing there weird. have to see the oncologist yet to decide next step. hope its not chemo. Good luck with your treatment. Pauline
Posts.Title: complete lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. Yes must keep in touch and compare our journeys. I still have to see oncologist to discuss next step. I know I need radiotherapy but chemo is still on the cards. Good luck. Pauline
Posts.Title: complete lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. You have described exactly how my arm feels. When I put my arm down by my side I feel as if I have a bagpipe under my arm. Which feels really swollen.Im hoping to discuss chemo soon but I definately will have radiotherapy at some stage. Take care and good luck
Posts.Title: complete lymph node clearance
